projectTitle: Fake News Detection Project
projectSummary: Project idea – Fake news spreads like a wildfire and this is a big issue in this era. We can learn how to distinguish fake news from a real one. We can use supervised learning to implement a model like this.

projectTitle: Smart Evaluation System
projectSummary: This system has three different levels of questions LOW, MEDIUM, and HARD. User start the evaluation test from the LOW level if user correctly answers, then the level get increased from LOW to MEDIUM. If user correctly answered for MEDIUM question the level gets raised from MEDIUM to HARD otherwise level is decreased from MEDIUM to LOW. For answering every HARD question correctly the user always gets harder question. At the HARD level if user is incorrect then the level decreased from HARD to MEDIUM. If the user again incorrect finally the level decreased from MEDIUM to LOW. For incorrectly answered for every LOW the user always get only LOW questions. At the end of the test faculty can evaluate the student strength based on the levels that particular attempts. If user have in depth knowledge then he/she tries for more HARD question otherwise user able to try only LOW or MEDIUM questions.

projectTitle: Deep learning framework based diagnosis of primary hypothyroidism and thyroid cancer using Convolution Neural Networks
projectSummary: The diagnosis of thyroid malignancy and benign is the challenge for the clinicians. Numerical values, Biopsy, Ultrasound are the various data sources for thyroid malignancy. Ultrasound is one of the standards imaging technology for diagnosis. To make the better prediction the proposed study adopts the extended machine learning techniques Deep Neural Network. Traditional preoperative diagnosis process includes both ultrasound check and fine needle aspiration. The malignancy report will be further confirmed by the surgical and pathological process. However, the proper diagnosis is considered to be the most challengeable task for the clinicians. In the recent subfield of machine learning, deep learning has been applied in most of the computer-aided diagnosis for better accuracy. The biological images are pre-processed and subjected to Training (70 % of data) and Testing (30 % of data). The proposed classifier is a kind of supervised classification based on deep neural network and convolution neural network which is trained by the ultrasound images with the benign or malignant label of pathology. The proposed system presents the most viable solutions to big data analysis in terms of efficiency and scalability The proposed model helps to minimize Medication prescription errors, adverse drug events and other medical errors further, the proposed model will be compared with the traditional random forest, support vector machine and neural networks for better results. The study will support the female students particularly those with PH to understand their improper lifestyle and thereby provide solution.

projectTitle: Interactive endeavour to enhance learning
projectSummary: Recent technologies provide wide opportunities for learning at remote places and enables people collaboration anywhere. This project aims to make the students learn from anywhere and anytime. It also act as a bridge between for the aspiring students whom want to learn the new technologies to the technological experts available in various domain. The proposed system uses an inter network for teacher - student interaction and sharing of resources and messages. It allows knowledge-building and learning process to be run in collaborative learning environment.

projectTitle: Smart Automated Water Management system for Sona Campus
projectSummary:
Water is considered as Elixir of Life. Unfortunately, vast amount of water is wasted due to various reasons. One among the major reasons being drippling of water from taps. With the increased, water scarcity problem it is very much essential to look on the inefficient wastage of water at various points. , The lack of adequate and integrated water management and poor water allocation is the main focus of this project. Currently, in India, water management system has been widely used for agriculture, industry and institutions.

The existing water management system takes more time to collect the data, which provides little information about the data. A proper decision on steps to control the water wastage cannot be taken up using the obtained data. In order to avoid the issues, the smart water management system is proposed to analyze the data and make the decision in a short time and at low cost. It performs the operations which includes identifying the leakages of the water and real-time monitoring of water levels in overhead tanks.

projectTitle: Virtual Lab for Programming Courses
projectSummary: Virtual Labs will provide to the students the result of an experiment by one of the following methods (or possibly a combination). Modeling the physical phenomenon by a set of equations and carrying out simulations to yield the result of the particular experiment. This can, at-the-best, provide an approximate version of the ‘real-world’ experiment. Providing measured data for virtual lab experiments corresponding to the data previously obtained by measurements on an actual system. Remotely triggering an experiment in an actual lab and providing the student the result of the experiment through the computer interface. This would entail carrying out the actual lab experiment remotely.

projectTitle: System (DIVS) using Application, Short Messaging Service and Automated Voice Call
projectSummary: In India, the Infant Mortality is as high. This is because the Infants are exposed to diseases which in some cases lead to death. Also there are lack of awareness and knowledge about the benefits of immunization. A solution to this is to digitize the way vaccines are monitored. The proposed system is DIVS using application, short messaging service (SMS) and automated voice calls. As an enhanced digitized solution to the problem of forgetting vaccines. The system provides two features communication and health care. It has been designed for Indian market with multi language capability too.

projectTitle: A Framework of Smart e-Learning Enrichment for Visually Challenged: e-SCRIBE
projectSummary: e-SCRIBE  is a tool for evaluation and intermittent learning of the students especially for the visually challenged. Very often we get to see visually challenged people seeking assistance to take tests like the Board exams, University examinations and the like. So this tool emphasizes on enabling them to take tests on their own with a voice enabled program. There are three modules in this project. Two of them are specially designed for the visually challenged persons and the third module can be used by any one. It is developed using Java with MySql as the backend.

projectTitle: Software Defined Network
projectSummary: his FDP aims to inculcate practical knowledge and experience the real time applications of Software Defined Networks (SDN).  The traditional rigid networking is not suitable to meet the current needs of   applications which require dynamism, intelligence and controllable networks when huge number of devices and systems get connected as in smart city, automated vehicles etc. There is an urge to redefine the concepts of networking to suit flexibility, automation and security which can be achieved through SDN. The participants will gain clear cut knowledge on the core concepts of SDN. They will be trained by the eminent academicians and industrial experts working currently in various domains of SDN like telecommunications (Ericsson – 5G), controllable switches and routers (CISCO – South Bound API), application interface (VMware – North bound API). It will widen their views and paves way for new innovations and scope for new research initiatives. The theme of this FDP is to upgrade the technical skills of recent trends in networking and thereby disseminating the gained knowledge to the student community in the right way and serve the society with many new inventions in this game changing field of the era.

projectTitle: Development of Nano Composite material for Electric Cable Applications
projectSummary:
Underground cable insulating material plays an energetic role in electric power system.  Cross linked polyethylene (XLPE) has been used for power cables since the early sixties, because of their outstanding electrical, thermal and mechanical properties. The quality of both the insulation and the semiconducting screen materials has been continuously improved with respect to production processes, contamination level, additives and so on. However, failure of cables due to electrical treeing phenomenon is still considered as a major problem when cables are aged due to both internal and external factors. Electrical treeing starts in the defective (or) weak portion of cable insulation due to enhanced localized electric field stress, which slowly builds up and finally bridges the high voltage conducting core with the ground. Throughout the world, great efforts have therefore been put into the development of new, improved insulation materials, aiming at the ultimate goal of developing an electric tree resistant material. 
	Nano composites are emerging as an innovative insulating material for challenging applications in all types of electrical equipment used in the power systems. The major objective of current research work is to develop innovative solid nano composite material for underground cable insulation.

history.commitMessage:
Underground cable insulating material plays an energetic role in electric power system.  Cross linked polyethylene (XLPE) has been used for power cables since the early sixties, because of their outstanding electrical, thermal and mechanical properties. The quality of both the insulation and the semiconducting screen materials has been continuously improved with respect to production processes, contamination level, additives and so on. However, failure of cables due to electrical treeing phenomenon is still considered as a major problem when cables are aged due to both internal and external factors. Electrical treeing starts in the defective (or) weak portion of cable insulation due to enhanced localized electric field stress, which slowly builds up and finally bridges the high voltage conducting core with the ground. Throughout the world, great efforts have therefore been put into the development of new, improved insulation materials, aiming at the ultimate goal of developing an electric tree resistant material. 
	Nano composites are emerging as an innovative insulating material for challenging applications in all types of electrical equipment used in the power systems. The major objective of current research work is to develop innovative solid nano composite material for underground cable insulation.

projectTitle: AUGMENTED REALITY BASED NATURAL INTERACTIVE LEARNING
projectSummary:
The goal of this project is to develop a real-time integrated augmented reality system to physically create topography models which are then scanned into a computer in real time, and used as background for a variety of graphics effects and simulations.

The main objective of the project is to develop a AR 3D T-Box that allows users to build topography models by shaping real sand, which is then augmented in real time by an elevation color map, topographic contour lines, and simulated water. The system teaches geographic, geologic, and hydrologic concepts such as how to read a topography map, the meaning of contour lines, watersheds, catchment areas, levees, etc.

projectTitle: Upliftment of down trodden community in the field of Entrepreneurship.
projectSummary:
The broad objective of this scheme to help SC/ST students is in designing, launching and running their own business/startup through entrepreneurship development programme after formal education is over/during their education as per AICTE’s startup policy.
The AICTE shall provide a limited one time financial assistance ( We received Rs. 13,75,667/-). A committee at the level of the institute be set up to select 9 startups of SC/ST students, who are already registered. Rs. 2 lakh per startup will be given as seed money which is non refundable. Rs. 2 lakh will be given to institute for meeting the expenditure on honorarium to the Eminent Faculty Members/ entrepreneur invited for conducting sessions on entrepreneurship.

projectTitle: Development of Digital Encoding System for Tamil Characters in Palm Leaf Manuscripts
projectSummary: Palm leaf manuscripts are organic in nature and susceptible to different type of deterioration. If not preserved properly they are subject to physical damage and decay. Some of the most deterioration agents are climatic factors like variations in relative humidity and temperature, light, insects, constant handling and adverse storage. Our forefathers went on inscribing on palm - leaves with their stylus until their hands ached. They copied old texts to be preserved for posterity. This tradition lasted until perhaps the time of our fathers. People of our generation have thrown these precious manuscripts into the river without making copies of them. A computer based printed reproduction of classical Tamil text from palm leaf manuscripts is proposed based on image processing techniques. Image processing techniques such as statistical and transform based approach can be used on the monochrome images of palm leaves for classifying different characters present on the palm leaves. The developed semi-automatic system would be capable of retrieving handwritten text into printable text.

projectTitle: AICTE - SKILL AND PERSONALITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME CENTRE FOR SC/ST STUDENTS
projectSummary: The broad objectives of the Centre shall be to provide opportunity to SC/ST students in the Institutes to reorient themselves in the light of emerging employment opportunities in Engineering undergraduate/Diploma students at all level. It is to empower the SC and ST students by providing special skill trainings apart from regular study. To enhance the skills of Scheduled Caste (SC)/Scheduled Tribe (ST) candidates with help of modules on communication, personality development and proficiency in  English  language.  It will boost the confidence of SC and ST students and provide them with better career opportunities so that their employability in the industry increases.

treatments in public health centers.

projectTitle: Study of dynamic behavior of defrosting on super hydrophobic surface
projectSummary: An experimental study is proposed to analyze the dynamic behavior of defrosting ice on a superhydrophobic surface. Ice accumulation can result in performance problems and safety concerns for transmission lines, marine and offshore structures, refrigeration, cryogenics, wind turbines, and heat exchangers. Wetting properties are important for ice formation on surfaces from the liquid phase, where the water repellency of the surfaces could enhance their anti-icing effect. Such surfaces will be prepared by using a nanotextured coating. A thermal evaporation system will be proposed for nanocoating on a copper surface. The prepared surface produces a contact angle of 162°±2°. The Low Bond Asymmetric Drop Shape analysis is used to measure the contact angle using imageJ software. The heat transfer performance of an evaporator is affected by frost formation. In this work, the heat transfer coefficient of the surface will be estimated in the defrosting process.  The effect of hydrophobicity and superhydrophobicity of surfaces, surface inclination, surface chemistry, morphology, and roughness scale will be studied on the defrosting process. In particular, wetting characteristics of the superhydrophobic surfaces revealed defrosting performance. The experiments will be performed in controlled environmental conditions. The anti-icing properties of superhydrophobic surfaces with different topography but similar chemistry are studied.

projectTitle: UV Sterilization Kit
projectSummary:
Automatic non-contact based UV (Ultraviolet) sterilization box is designed with 
combined features of an automatic opening and closing of the box by proximity 
sensing method and UV-C (Ultraviolet C) light sterilizer .Here an IR Sensor is 
fixed to the box which senses hand movement. If any hand movement is sensed 
by the sensor, it gives signal to the microcontroller board. Then the door 
mechanism operates and opens the box door for few seconds and closes 
automatically. The door mechanism is controlled by a servo motor. The object 
which is placed on the glass shelf is sterilized by the UV-C light which will turn 
on when the door is closed and turns off automatically after sterilization is 
finished. After completion of this process, the door opens automatically and the 
object can be taken out .The UV-C light is flashed over the entire surface of an 
object which destroys the DNA of viruses and bacteria. This ensures that the 
device eliminates the cross contamination. Essential materials are generally not 
being sterilized by even those who are at high risk of infection from corona such 
as health, sanitation and security personnel. Any virus can be deactivated up to 
99% by the ultraviolet germicidal irradiation (UVGI) dose of 2,400 
microwatt.sec/cm2

projectTitle:
DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT OF CLINICAL DEVICE KIT AND 
VENDING MEDICINE FOR PATIENTS
projectSummary:
Whole worlds is suffering due to pandemic of Covid-19, people are scared due to spreading 
diseases that may cause severe effects and leads to death. Even many hospital staffs and doctors life are 
under risk and have more chance to contact with the affected persons and leads to death. In present scenario 
health workers are the one who are highly affected, because treating the patients and giving medication. 
The proposed idea of the project is to reduce the infection through development of vending machine for the 
patients to give medicine automatically on time and this data is stored in SD card for future references 
Further clinical devices consists of features such as Pulse Oximeter and pressure measurement devices 
for critical medication and immediate medical care for patients

projectTitle: Experimental  Investigation of performance and emission characteristics  of Multi cylinder Innova (Crysta) diesel engine using biodiesel blends with diesel
projectSummary:
The Toyota Industries Engine India Private Limited, Bangaluru sponsored a new Crysra high speed four cylinder multi cylinder diesel engine with maximum power of 147 HP controlled by the electronics system. This multi cylinder engine established in Department of Mechanical Engineering at Sona College of Technology .The test engine follows new emission norms and used in luxury cars with the turbo charging techniques and gives the maximum efficiency and reduced exhaust emission. The engine working with any type of biodiesel is to be analyzed to test the performance and emission characteristics of the engine. 
Our College management sanctioned Rs. 10 Lakh money through seed money scheme and this money is to be utilized to convert the engine in to a fully computerized engine.  The engine can be used by our Institution staff members doing their doctoral degree and the internal research scholars, research scholars from various external institutions and universities. It can also be used by internal and external UG and PG Students doing project works and for the R&D work by the various automobile industries.

projectTitle: Design and Development of a Cost Effective Teaching Assistive Device cum Application for Blind Deaf Children's
projectSummary: Deaf-blindness is a combination of both hearing and visual impairments. Educators who work with such individuals have a unique challenge in order to ensure a meaningful communication. Every individual in this group may have varied range of understanding level and response time. Therefore, the teacher should allow time for the student to respond. The major form of  communication includes: Touch cues, Object symbols, Fingerspelling, Braille etc. Hence there is a need to design and develop a cost effective teaching assistive device cum application for the Blind Deaf children.  This approach enables the children’s who are deafblind to learn and communicate with normal  people. It also generates a Braille output for the given text information.

projectTitle: Development of Grievance Redressal Application in Android platform, Web application and  SMS based Software
projectSummary: This Mobile application is developed for submitting the grievance by the railway employee. In-order to submit a grievance the employee has to register himself / herself on the portal using their PF number. Once the registration process is completed, they can submit the grievance through Grievance Submission Form which is a simple form that requires minimum fields to be given by the employee and other details are fetched from the backend storage. Submitted Grievance are verified and validated by the section in-charge using their admin credentials. To track the Grievance Status, employee can use the Grievance Status form. The progress bar in the Grievance form denotes the progress of grievance submitted. To view the User’s Basic information a profile form is available

projectTitle: Intelligent Bus Scheduling System
projectSummary: The projects helps to schedule the buses in an intelligent way during festival seasons. During local festivals or common festivals in a country the buses are over loaded and prone to accidents causing damages to human lives. This is avoid when our Intelligent Bus Scheduling System is used. This project was funded by Tamilnadu State Council for Science and Technology under student project scheme.

projectTitle: An intelligent tuberculosis analytics for increasing life expectancy of women in slums of Salem, tamilnadu
projectSummary:
Tuberculosis (TB) is one of the ancient and deadliest diseases in the world. In India, 
TB is one among the top 10 deadliest diseases. Since 1881 AD TB is in live and it is a 
high challenge in the medical community. In India 20000 people are affected every 
year and 5000 people develop the airborne disease and 600 people lose their lives 
because of TB. 2025 has been aimed at “Elimination of Tb” and by 2030 WHO has 
been dedicated for the TB eradication by WHO. The TB disease is treatable and 
curable. The lack of advertisement and the ignorance of TB is the main reason for its 
existence. To address this problem the following objectives are framed

projectTitle: An ideal design of Automated HKFAO for people with locomotive disabilities in an affordable cost
projectSummary:
To provide dynamic support and control for individuals with hip disabilities and after any hip surgeries. It can control hip movements either unilaterally or bilaterally as needed. It will be general custom made to a patient's measurements. HOs are commonly used to position the person in standing, walking and sitting. 

To support to knees that have been injured in the past. Sports persons often a major injury in this particular place so that it will be guide them to walk and sit with the controlled movements. They keep the knee stable but still allow limited movement while it is healing. These are designed to relieve pain in people who have arthritis in their knees. 

To specially design for shoe inserts that help support the feet and improve foot position. People who have chronic foot or leg problems that interfere with the health and functioning of their feet may be prescribed orthoses by their podiatrist. Athletes may also wear orthoses to help correct foot problems that could hinder their performance. A huge weight persons may also wear this orthosis to walk in perfect steps. If foot orthoses are considered necessary, a comprehensive understanding of your foot function will be required. This may be done by examining your foot, including the range of motion of your foot joints, the strength of the muscles in your feet, and the position of the bones in your feet when you stand. Foot orthoses are specially designed shoe inserts that help support the feet and correct any imbalances. Some of the foot and lower limb problems that can be successfully treated in the long term with orthoses include corns and calluses, foot ulceration, tendonitis, recurrent ankle sprain, plantar fasciitis or heel spur syndrome and recurrent stress fractures. The same level of stabilization provided by a cast-boot can be accomplished by an AFO with better function and patient compliance

projectTitle: Empowering Socio-Economic Status of Tribal Women in Yercaud, Salem Dt, Tamilnadu through Mulberry Sericulture
projectSummary:
During the outbreak of Covid-19, which started from China and slowly captured nearly 127 countries, this invisible
enemy has almost got us all. This is one of the worst periods in history. Almost all countries were under lockdown. It
has shaken us and our economy almost all big giants like United States, China and the European Union are under
economic meltdown. This pandemic has shaken up both the human race and the economies of all the countries.
From past few months, what we have seen that is inconceivable. From the economic point of view, a major concern
is the future of the textile industry. The textile and clothing industry employs over 105 million people and earns
around USD40 billion in forex, aside from substantial revenue under GST and other taxes.
Domestically, there would be very less consumption has been expected till February 2021. Big brands and small
retails all of them are halted their production and buying raw material as well as cut the buying budgets to prepare
them for any shortfalls during this year. Banarasi saree manufacturers are in less in demand during this pandemic
as same as other fabrics. But, Post Covid-19, would be in the high demand to fulfill due to ceremonies are on halt
and expected to have a load of ceremony start in near future.
In general the women’s status is measured in terms of their level of education, employment, income and their roles
and responsibilities in the family and society. At the same time the status of tribal women is in very low level, we
must accept that fact. The basic reason behind this low level is lack of education and empowerment. Without money
and education, many tribal works as labors in industries, households and construction. Despite exploitation by
contractors and managers, tribal are more sincere and honest thannon-tribal. Their condition remains unchanged
even during the modern times with only few changes. In India, women ever had given any right of liberty and
equality. In addition to above China has banned the export of 1500 tons Silk and would increase the danger in the
future after couple of months.
This project aims to empower the tribal women through sericulture. Sericulture is an important agro based cottage
industries. It has a great potentiality to generate employment opportunities on a massive sale in rural section. India
has been ranked as the second major and largest silk production in the world. The target of this project is to develop
the empowerment of tribal women through sericulture activities at Yercaud in Salem district in Tamil Nadu.

history.commitMessage: Submitted in DST which is under review

projectTitle: FDP ONMACHINE LEARNING TOOLS FOR RESEARCH PROBLEM SOLVING UNDER AICTE ATAL SCHEME
projectSummary: Machine Learning (ML) is a major step forward in how computer system adapts, evolves and learns. It has widespread application in almost every industry and is considered to be a big technological shift, similar in scale to past events such as the industrial revolution, the computer age, and the smart phone revolution. This course will give an opportunity to gain expertise in one of the most fascinating and fastest growing areas of Computer Science through classroom program that covers fascinating and compelling topics related to human intelligence and its applications in industry, defense, healthcare, agriculture and many other areas. This course will give the audience a rigorous, advanced foundation in Machine Learning.

projectTitle: AN IDEAL DESIGN OF SMART HKFAO ADDRESSING LOCOMOTOR DIFFICULTIES OF ELDERLY AND GAIT CHALLENGING PERSONS
projectSummary:
Persons who are suffering in locomotive disabilities due to various factors like paralysis /
stroke, spinal cord injury, polio and accidents. Major percentage of disabled person in
India are the one with locomotor disability as per the report given by The National Sample
Survey of the Union Labour Ministry. Particularly the major spinal cord injuries and
neural problems are occurred in road accidents such that more number of young aged
people lost their dreamiest / future life. And further they undergone highly risk surgery
with more expensive. Even after medical treatment they couldn’t run their life
independently. For their own necessarily work. Obliviously they need to use wheel chairs,
supportive hand sticks and walking HKFA calliper. The prolonged usage of these walking
aids and wheelchairs make the persons lazy and depressed.
To rehabilitation for such people maximum medical supports required for their recovery.
To meet out the present fast running world scenario, the locomotive disability persons
needs a speedy recovery and independent life style. Through this proposed project to
overcome the problems by adapting the automated smart HKFAO Hip-Knee-Ankle-FootOrthosis, they will change over the life style from illness to normal day to day life.

history.commitMessage: This project was applied to funding for DST-SEED division under TIDE scheme. The funding amount is Rs.  70,88,000. It is still under review

keywords: Locomotor disabilities,Smart HKFAO, Kinematics and Dynamics, non-invasive BCI, Gait Simuation

projectTitle: Faculty Development Program on Design and Development of Software Designed Networks
projectSummary: This FDP aims to inculcate practical knowledge and experience the real time applications of Software Defined Networks - SDN.  SDN is a new era of intelligent networking emerged   to tune the network based on demands and control the networking components through programming The traditional rigid networking is not suitable to meet the current needs of   applications which require dynamism, intelligence and controllable networks when huge number of devices and systems get connected as in smart city and automated vehicles and etc. In order to satisfy the requirements of the end user, there is an urge to redefine the concepts of networking to suit flexibility and automation which can be accomplished with the help of SDN

projectTitle: Smart ward bed to rocket elderly care in hospitals and homes
projectSummary: Most of the accidents at the medical institutions are bedsores and fall accidents while treating the elderly patients with mobility impairment. Nursing a disabled person is a challenging task, as a nurse has to understand each and every patient mindset and also have to clean the patient feces in order to maintain a healthy environment around the patient. One of the reasons for this high rate of accidents is the lack of nursing personnel. In order to aid caregivers while nursing elderly patients who are not able to move about freely. The proposed project aims at design and develops a smart bed enabled with latest technologies such as IoT and AI. This arrangement would enable the patient to obtain a timely attention from nurses/caregivers. This would keep them comfortable as well as prevent them falling accidentally and also fasten their recovery period.

projectTitle: Development of Near Field Communicator (NFC) based safety helmet for labour safety
projectSummary: The NFC tags are fixed in appropriate place of helmet. The NFC reader is is fixed near the door lock. The door lock is based on the electromagnetic system. The reader enables the locking system. When the person shows the NFC helmet, the reader check the validation of TAG and enable the locking system. The tag will be enabled only when the distance between tag and reader is 3 CM.

history.commitMessage: The work was completed. The distance covered by the Tag reading position is only 3CM. Therefore alternative method is tried to increase the distance.

projectTitle: Hearing Aid Smart Supporting System
projectSummary: “Hearing Aid Smart Supporting System” is used to support deaf people whose hearing loss at various stages such as mild, moderate and severe. A hearing aid mobile application (APP) is developed using matlab and deployed in android hardware. .  The smart mobile microphone is used to collect the voice. The execution of APP gives the 4 adjustable sliding bars. Volume adjustment slider is used to vary the input value volume from 1 to 25. The filter adjustment slider is used to reduce the noise present in the signal. The center frequency slider is used to assign the specific voice level. The gain adjustment slider is used to vary the sensing level. The android hardware microphone input is multiplied using the constant value set in the master volume slider. The preprocessing includes ADC conversion and level adjustments. The noise filter eliminates the unwanted signal due to high gain settings. The balanced equalizer reads the input from center frequency and gain. The filtered signal is converted into hearable voice based on center frequency and gain level. The output is available in android speaker.

history.commitMessage: The development of APP was completed.

projectTitle: IOT based security wake up system
projectSummary: The security wake up system generates the alarm and multicolor reflected lighting. The time of alarm is random in manner. Once alarm signal is given, a security person have to show the presence in front of device. It makes the security person active. Security alert and security response times are updated in cloud server.

history.commitMessage: The work was completed and successfully tested. 3 no of units are completed.

projectTitle: PULSE PLATING FOR SILVER ANKLET
projectSummary: The common technology used now in plating the silver anklet is normal DC plating where direct current (DC) is supplied to the plating bath as straight DC current. This has major disadvantage like consuming more silver during plating due to long exposure of anklets to the electrodes and electrolytes. Instead a new technology, pulse plating is introduced for plating of silver anklet  using electro deposition method. In pulse plating, the DC power arrives in the bath in a series of short pulses. These pulse cycles can be regulated at predetermined rates to over 10,000 times per second.  Precise changes in the regulation of these cycles provide different results to the plated deposits, depending on the metal being plated. Typical advantages of pulse plating include better distribution, lower porosity, higher density, greater throwing power, improved hardness and less metal usage.
